Article Title: Public prosecutor gets prosecuted by accused
Article Text:
Supreme Court

NEW DLEHI: Supreme Court Monday requested the Bombay HC chief justice to expeditiously decide the petition filed by a special public prosecutor for quashing an FIR lodged against him by the accused whose prosecution was being conducted by the lawyer.Appearing for advocate Shekhar Kakasaheb Jagtap, senior advocate Gaurav Agrawal told a bench of CJI BR Gavai and Justice K Vinod Chandran that the petitioner, was prosecuting the accused - former Mumbai police commissioner Param Bir Singh and businessman Sanjay Punamiya - on complaints filed by another businessman Sunder Agarwal.The senior advocate told SC though Jagtap has sought quashing of the FIR lodged against him by Punamiya, the HC judges have recused themselves from hearing his petition. Moreover, the case assigned to a judge now has been lying in cold storage for the last one year, he said.SC requested the Bombay HC CJ to withdraw the case to a bench headed by him for an expeditious hearing on Jagtap's petition. It gave liberty to Jagtap to mention the matter for urgent hearing before the CJ based on the SC order.The allegation against Jagtap is that he had forged letters appointing him as special public prosecutor in cases against Param Bir Singh. Jagtap said Punamiya had filed several other complaints against him before Bar Council of Maharashtra and Goa, which had rejected the allegations. He said police mechanically filed the FIR without conducting a preliminary inquiry into veracity of the complaints against him despite knowing that he has been practicing for the last 23 years and has been empaneled as counsel for Maharashtra govt.
Article Summary: Supreme Court requested the Bombay HC chief justice to expeditiously decide the petition filed by a special public prosecutor. Shekhar Kakasaheb Jagtap was prosecuting the accused - former Mumbai police commissioner Param Bir Singh and businessman Sanjay Punamiya. Jagtap said Punamiya had filed several other complaints against him.

Article Title: DMK challenges SIR in SC, raises voter purge fear
Article Text:
Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin (ANI photo/file)

EC To Launch SIR in 12 States and UTs in Phase 2, CEC Gyanesh Kumar Says Zero Complaints in Bihar

DMK in SC: SIR exercise can disenfranchise lakhs of voters

NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu's governing party DMK on Monday filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the constitutional validity of the Election Commission 's decision to conduct special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls of all states.It alleged that SIR is an arbitrary exercise that would lead to removal of voters' names from the lists.DMK said a special summary revision of TN voter list was conducted between Oct 2024 and January 2025.The revision had addressed issues of migration, death and deletion of ineligible voters from the existing state electoral roll."The SIR and the Orders, if not set aside, can arbitrarily and without due process, disenfranchise lakhs of voters from electing their representatives, thereby disrupting free and fair elections and democracy in the country, which are part of the basic structure of the Constitution," said DMK said through its organising secretary R S Bharathi.DMK said the Bihar SIR was carried out by introducing new and stringent requirements for voters to provide proof of citizenship, particularly for those who were not registered as voters in the 2003 electoral roll.It cited several orders of the SC, tweaking the procedure and allowing Aadhaar as an identity proof.DMK and said the procedure adopted by EC in conducting SIR is neither prescribed in the Representation of the People Act nor in Conduct of Election Rules."There is neither a necessity for conducting de novo verification of electoral rolls nor a compelling reason for such extensive exercise." it said. DMK said, "...SIR is bound to cause uncertainty and disenfranchisement of a significant number of voters, as seen in Bihar", a charge yet not accepted by the SC, which is still seized of the matter.
Article Summary: Tamil Nadu's governing party DMK filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court. It is challenging the constitutional validity of the Election Commission's decision. It alleged that SIR is an arbitrary exercise that would lead to removal of voters' names from the lists.

Article Title: 'What he is saying is a lie': Kharge hits out at PM Modi's 'Katta' charge; calls it 'laughable'
Article Text:
PM Modi Rips Into RJD-Congress For ‘Insulting Faith’, Warns Bihar Voters

NEW DELHI: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday refuted Prime Minister Narendra Modi's allegation that Rashtriya Janata Dal forced Congress to announce Tejashwi Yadav as Mahagathbandhan's pick for Bihar's chief minister's post.Kharge said that PM Modi's remarks were "laughable", claiming that he sets aside he level at which a PM should speak."All of this is a lie. He has nothing else to say. I will answer this today in Bihar. What he is saying is a lie. Nobody will tell someone else to make someone the CM at gunpoint," Kharge said."Congress has never done this. Modi ji is the PM of this country; his saying such things is laughable. This shows his level. He sets aside the level at which a PM should speak and is making election speeches in Bihar," he added.This comes a day after PM Modi on Sunday alleged thate Congress “never wanted” Tejashwi to be declared the alliance’s CM face but was pressured into doing so.“The RJD secured it by placing a katta (country-made gun) on the head of the Congress. They have learnt their lessons in the school of jungle raj. Such elements can never do good for Bihar,” he said at a rally in Bhojpur."Just a day before nomination filing, behind closed doors, gundagardi was happening. Congress did not want to have an RJD CM, but RJD did not leave the opportunity. They put a Katta on Congress' head and stole the CM’s post," he added.He further claimed that the alliance partners were divided and would “break each other’s heads” after the elections.Hectic campaigning in poll-bound Bihar is set to continue on Monday, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge scheduled to address a host of public rallies across the state.The party's octogenarian national president Mallikarjun Kharge will also address his maiden election meeting, ahead of assembly polls, in Vaishali district.Polling for Bihar’s 243 assembly seats will take place in two phases: on November 6 and 11, with counting on November 14.
Article Summary: Kharge said that PM Modi's remarks were "laughable", claiming that he sets aside he level at which a PM should speak. Polling for Bihar’s 243 assembly seats will take place in two phases: on November 6 and 11, with counting on November 14.

Article Title: Midday horror in Bengaluru: Man flashes at woman walking dog on Domlur Road; police launch manhunt
Article Text:
Representative image





BENGALURU: A 33-year-old woman from West Bengal residing in East Bengaluru working in a private firm alleged that she was sexually harassed by an unidentified man while walking her dog on November 1.According to her complaint with Indiranagar police, the incident happened around 11:55 am on 5th Main Road in Domlur Second Stage, Indiranagar. The accused allegedly flashed at her and indulged in an obscene act.The woman took her dog for a walk as she does every day. Someone called out 'Madam' from behind. When she turned around, she saw a man, believed to be in his 30s, wearing a brown T-shirt and grey zip-style shorts.The man stared at her, flashed at her, and acted obscenely. The woman stated that she froze for a few seconds in shock, but the man continued the act despite noticing her reaction. Feeling unsafe, she immediately ran back home with her dog.She later informed her sister and a male friend and filed a complaint the next day. A senior officer said they are analysing the CCTV camera footage from the spot and surrounding areas to ascertain clues on the accused. A case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) section 75 (sexual harassment).
Article Summary: A 33-year-old woman from West Bengal residing in East Bengaluru working in a private firm alleged that she was sexually harassed by an unidentified man. The incident happened around 11:55 am on 5th Main Road in Domlur Second Stage, Indiranagar. The accused allegedly flashed at her and indulged in an obscene act.

Article Title: Coimbatore gang rape: Survivor unable to identify attackers from 60 mugshots; cops probe city’s migrant labour clusters
Article Text:
West Bengal Police Arrest Three in Connection with Durgapur Gang-Rape Case

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)





COIMBATORE: A 20-year-old postgraduate student was abducted and gang-raped by three men in Coimbatore on Sunday night after she and her boyfriend were attacked while sitting in a parked car near Brindhavan Nagar, behind the city airport.According to police, the incident took place around 10.30pm when three men arrived on a moped, smashed the car’s windshield, and assaulted the woman’s boyfriend with weapons. The men then threatened the woman and took her on their moped to a deserted area about a kilometre away, where they raped her multiple times.The injured man managed to call the Peelamedu police around 11pm, prompting an overnight search. The woman was found around 4am, and police recovered a stolen moped believed to have been used by the assailants. She was admitted to a private hospital for treatment.On Monday night, police arrested three suspects — Sathish, Guna, and Karthik — after an encounter in which they sustained gunshot injuries. All three are from Madurai district and worked as daily wage labourers staying in a rented house in Coimbatore. They are undergoing treatment at the Coimbatore Medical College Hospital.However, investigators said the survivor could not identify the attackers when shown more than 60 photographs of known offenders.“The CCTV cameras in the area failed to capture their faces due to glare,” a police source said.City police commissioner A Saravana Sundar said seven special teams have been formed to probe the case and verify the suspects’ involvement. “The survivor is in shock, while her friend is stable,” he said, adding that investigators are now focusing on migrant labour clusters in and around Coimbatore to trace possible leads.Meanwhile, AIADMK’s women’s wing has called for a protest over the incident, and BJP MLA Vanathi Srinivasan visited the crime scene on Monday evening along with party functionaries.
Article Summary: A 20-year-old postgraduate student was abducted and gang-raped by three men in Coimbatore on Sunday night. The victim and her boyfriend were attacked while sitting in a parked car near Brindhavan Nagar, behind the city airport. Police arrested three suspects — Sathish, Guna, and Karthik — after an encounter in which they sustained gunshot injuries.
